triples.name: Bifurcation theory
triples.relevance: Paper analyzes bifurcation phenomena in evolutionary game dynamical systems on lattices.

triples.name: Symbolic dynamics
triples.relevance: Symbolic dynamics is examined to characterize the chaotic properties and dynamical complexity of the systems.

triples.name: Evolutionary game theory
triples.relevance: Core theoretical framework for analyzing evolutionary strategies and payoff dynamics in the lattice models.

triples.name: Evolution strategy
triples.relevance: The paper studies evolutionary strategies on lattices using game-theoretic and dynamical systems approaches.

triples.name: Topological conjugacy
triples.relevance: Paper derives 14 topological conjugacy classes through homeomorphisms to classify equivalent dynamical systems.

triples.name: Normal-form game
triples.relevance: Payoff matrix parameters are key variables for analyzing the evolutionary game dynamics.

triples.name: Chicken (game)
triples.relevance: Snowdrift game (hawk-dove game) serves as a specific case study for analyzing symbolic dynamics and chaotic properties.

triples.name: Topological entropy
triples.relevance: Paper derives nonzero topological entropy to characterize chaotic behavior in the evolutionary game systems.

triples.name: Chaos theory
triples.relevance: Paper analyzes chaotic characteristics including mixing property and sensitivity to initial conditions.

triples.name: Dynamical system
triples.relevance: Evolutionary game dynamical systems on lattices are the primary objects of study.

triples.name: Homeomorphism
triples.relevance: Homeomorphisms are used to establish topological conjugacy classes among the 27 evolutionary game systems.

triples.name: Dimensionality reduction
triples.relevance: Paper proposes an effective dimensionality reduction method based on addition and scalar multiplication invariance.
